Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Secretive \Se*cret"ive\, a. Tending to secrete, or to keep secret or private; as, a secretive disposition. [1913 Webster]

secretive adj : inclined to secrecy or reticence about divulging information; "although they knew her whereabouts her friends kept close about it" [syn: {close}, {closelipped}, {closemouthed}, {tightlipped}]
